comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: It would be great to put a few names to the blokes in overalls. Any takers? In this pic we see the bloke in overalls in front of Ennis with one of the hydraulic jacks which were used to keep the two spans in position a precise distance apart whilst the final joins were made. It looks as if the jack has just been dropped into place...the blokes over on the left might be connecting the hydraulic lines. I suspect this pic might have been taken on 8/9/1930...over at SRNSW it appears in their sequence of Harbour Bridge pics following a pic taken on 8/9/1930, which shows the hydraulic and screw jacks in position at one of the top chord centre joints - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... ; investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283755242/ I'm fairly sure we also see Hipwell in this pic (taken on 10/9/1930 at the top chord) and also the bloke in overalls in front of Ennis...but if so, then going on the clothes they're wearing, the two pics appear to have been taken on different days. www.youtube.com/watch?v=JPQ7CzVHdMs this fascinating vid describes how the top chords were joined (between ca. 15:00-19:45)

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: From the SRNSW sequence of Harbour Bridge pics, we can see that parties of engineers (Ennis, Bradfield, etc) were at the top chord centre joints on 8/9/1930, 10/9/1930 (the day the top chords were joined) - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... , and 12/9/1930 - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... ...and for all we know they might have made visits on other days as well. This perhaps accounts for the differences in personnel and clothing which we see in some of the pics taken at the top chord in September 1930. This NSW Transport RMS pic is dated 5/9/1930...it also shows jacks being placed in one of the top chord centre joints...I haven't worked out how to link to the pic...the link appears to only last until the session is timed out... hopefully this will get yo to the NSW Transport RMS library front door www.rtaphotolibrary.com.au then search using the photo id 19300905HB35886.jpg

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... in this SRNSW pic dated 12/9/1930 (presumably taken from one of the creeper cranes) we see the steel 'packs' now in situ in the gap between the two spans.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: ses.library.usyd.edu.au/handle/2123/339?mode=full ...this pic from the JJC Bradfield Collection at the University of Sydney provides info re the Bradfield sons who we see in some of the top chord pics...in the Bradfield Collection pic we see 'Mr A. Bradfield' (either Anthony or Alan)...and 'Dr S.G. Bradfield' (Stanley).
